question: When is the International Day of Tolerance observed by UNESCO?
explanation:
The International Day of Tolerance observed every year on November 16th. It aims to promote tolerance among cultures and people and make them understand that tolerance is an integral part of society.
“The UNESCO Madanjeet Singh Prize for the Promotion of Tolerance and Non-Violence” has been awarded to the NGO named Résolution Conflits (Centre for Resolution of Conflicts ) in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
